block.p: Elinor Robinson Corkran and W. James Murphy Jr. were married yesterday by the Rev. David Ware, an Episcopal priest, at Old Swedes Church in Wilmington, Del.

Mrs. Murphy, 32, is a cook and food stylist for the Food Network, the cable television network in New York. She graduated from Connecticut College and Peter Kump's New York Cooking School. She is the daughter of Susan and Donald Corkran of Chadds Ford, Pa. Her father retired as a senior vice president and head of the trust department of the Wilmington Trust Company in Wilmington and chairman of Wilmington Trust of Florida in Stuart, Fla. Her mother is a beekeeper.
Elinor Robinson Corkran and W. James Murphy Jr. were married yesterday by the Rev. David Ware, an Episcopal priest, at Old Swedes Church in Wilmington, Del.

Mrs. Murphy, 32, is a cook and food stylist for the Food Network, the cable television network in New York. She graduated from Connecticut College and Peter Kump's New York Cooking School. She is the daughter of Susan and Donald Corkran of Chadds Ford, Pa. Her father retired as a senior vice president and head of the trust department of the Wilmington Trust Company in Wilmington and chairman of Wilmington Trust of Florida in Stuart, Fla. Her mother is a beekeeper.
The bride wore her mother's wedding dress of white peau de soie and veil of rose-point lace.

Mr. Murphy, 32, is known as Jim. He is a vice president for investment services at Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities in New York. He graduated from Trinity College in Hartford and received a master's degree in management from Northwestern University. He is a director of the Phi Kappa Educational Foundation of Trinity.

He is the son of Debbie and Walter J. Murphy of Vero Beach, Fla. His father retired as the assistant to the president of the Christopher D. Smithers Foundation, an alcoholism research and treatment organization in Mill Neck, N.Y. The bridegroom's parents owned Murphy Associates, a public relations agency, which was in New York. From 1957 to 1967, Mrs. Murphy sang at the Pierre in New York. She also sang with the Billy May and Pee Wee Hunt orchestras in the 1940's and 50's. Mr. Murphy was the publicist for Arthur Godfrey and the personal manager for Rosemary Clooney.
